page.title: 14DECLINE OF HOP GROWING.
page.content: 15 acres of Bockingfold Farm is used for growing hops.A couple of years ago it was a very profitable business to be in but this has now changed.We were informed that the cost of wire for just 1 hop garden costs as much as 2,500 pounds.Nowadays hops can be stored for up to 4 years in pellet form.Kent has stock to last until 1988 and so farmers are looking for more profitable crops like rape seed. New types of hops have more flavour than some of the older varieties and therefore fewer are needed.The enormous cost of production means that many of the smaller farms can no longer afford to grow hops. Tastes in beer drinking are changing and many people now prefer the less bitter tasting beers which contain fewer hops.
